word: Many Printing Plants Needed.--I have words to speak to you [TO THE GENERAL CONFERENCE PRESIDENT AND TO THE MANAGER OF THE REVIEW AND HERALD.] You must be guarded in your plans, for you are in danger of centralizing. If you should follow your natural dispositions, there would be a tendency to so arrange the publishing work that the majority of our books would bear the imprint of Washington. The danger of such a course compels me to speak.
